posts.title: RESHAPE Lab paper accepted at AIware Conference 2024
posts.description:
We are excited to announce that our latest research paper ('Unveiling the Potential of a Conversational Agent in Developer Support: Insights from Mozilla‚Äôs PDF.js Project'), developed in collaboration with researchers from PUC-Rion and with Mozilla, has been accepted at AIware 2024, the 1st ACM International Conference on AIware. This milestone underscores RESHAPE Lab's commitment to the forefront of software engineering and artificial intelligence research.

The paper introduces a novel conversational agent that enhances how developers interact with software projects. Utilizing a sophisticated Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architecture, the agent reduces reliance on human mentors by providing direct access to project-specific data, thereby streamlining the development process. This tool represents a significant step toward automating developer support, making it both more efficient and accessible.

Our findings from a detailed case study on Mozilla‚Äôs PDF.js project demonstrate the agent's ability to outperform traditional human-based support in many scenarios, highlighting its potential to transform developer interactions in open-source software projects. This research not only contributes to academic knowledge but also offers practical tools for improving productivity and efficiency in software development.

This study was also supported by the National Science Foundation (award #2303042) titled 'Learning Software Engineering by Contributing to Real Projects With Chatbot Assistance'. This research explores the impactful role of conversational agents in enhancing support in open source communities.

We look forward to sharing our insights at AIware 2024 in Porto de Galinhas and continuing to advance the field of AI in software engineering.

posts.title: Collaboration USES/UFAM -- RESHAPE/NAU!
posts.description:
NAU will receive six Brazilian scholars as part of a project led by the Institute of Computing at the Federal University of Amazonas, that includes a partnership with the School of Informatics Computing and Cyber Systems at NAU. The proposal, titled 'Enhancing the Quality of Software Projects: Techniques for Supporting Software Development with a Focus on Process and Product Quality,' aims to develop new technologies to improve software quality. It focuses on enhancing user experience (UX) and developer experience (DX) through innovative approaches. The project will apply evidence-based methodologies for creating new approaches, focusing on conceiving inclusive technologies with a special interest in diverse populations.

This grant was awarded by the Brazilian National Council for Scientific and Technological Development (CNPq) as part of a solicitation that focused on fostering the internationalization of Brazilian universities by strengthening their collaboration with strong groups outside of Brazil.>

This project is led by Dr. Tayana Uch√¥a Conte, Associate Professor at the Federal University of Amazonas, in collaboration with Dr. Igor Steinmacher, Assistant Professor at SICCS. According to the plan, NAU will receive 6 scholars in an 18-month time frame, including 2 Ph.D. candidates, 2 Early Career Researchers, and 2 Senior Researchers.

posts.title: RESHAPE Lab hat trick at ICSE 2024!
posts.description:
RESHAPE Lab will be very well represented at ICSE 2024 in Lisbon! Members of our lab are co-authors of three papers in the Research Track that will be presented at the conference:

  • 'How to Support ML End-User Programmers through a Conversational Agent' by Emily Judith Arteaga Garcia, Jo√£o Felipe Pimentel, Zixuan Feng, Marco Gerosa, Igor Steinmacher, Anita Sarma

Two of the papers are part of projects in collaboration with EPIC Lab from Oregon State University, and the last one is a paper with Bianca Trinkenreich in industry context.
